Detroit Public Television (DPTV) is responding to the learning needs of families with children at home as a result of Michigan schools being closed because of the COVID-19 crisis by adjusting its entire daytime programming schedule.

From 7 a.m. until 6 p.m., Monday through Friday, DPTV will offer blocks of programming geared to specific age groups ‚Äì early childhood, middle school, and high school ‚Äì on its main broadcast channel (56.1), as part of a collaboration with Michigan‚Äôs public television stations and the national PBS system.

While Michigan schools are closed this school year, weekday programming will be as follows:

‚Ä¢ Current PBS KIDS programming (Ages 2-8 years old) ‚Äì 7 a.m. to 9 a.m.
‚Ä¢ Grades 4th-8th ‚Äì 9 a.m. to 1 p.m.
‚Ä¢ Grades 9th-12th ‚Äì 1 p.m. to 6 p.m.

DPTV‚Äôs schedule during those hours will be filled with PBS programming that aligns with curriculum goals, with online learning activities associated with each show. The programs are designed to supplement children‚Äôs learning and not be a replacement for grade-level credit.
